Key Match Events: Brendan Donovan hit a three-run homer in the third inning.
Iván Herrera hit an RBI double in the sixth and scored on a throwing error by Austin Wells following a wild pitch by Mark Leiter Jr.
Andrew Kittredge gave up Giancarlo Stanton’s three-run double off the top of the center-field fence to make it a one-run game.
Juan Soto doubled with two down in the ninth inning, followed by an intentional walk to Aaron Judge, and Helsley fanned Wells on a slider for the final out.
Post-Match Reflections: Brendan Donovan matched a career high in homers and mentioned the historical significance of the win.
Aaron Boone acknowledged the impact of Giancarlo Stanton's triple on the game.
Juan Soto reflected on the game's drama in the ninth inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was the first victory for St. Louis in the Bronx since 1964.
Oswaldo Cabrera struck out on a pitch-clock violation and Gleyber Torres flied out in the ninth inning.
Ryan Helsley became the first Cardinal to record a save in the Bronx since 1964.
